param.name: instance
param.label: SysView instance
param.description: Instance name for this SysView app

param.name: queryInterval
param.label: Query interval
param.info: SysView will query the process, data and other components of the system at regular intervals. This is the interval between queries, in seconds.

param.name: process
param.label: Process params
param.info: These parameters control how the information about the processes is interpreted on the diagram.

param.name: outlineColor
param.label: Outline color
param.description: Color of the process icon outlines
param.info: Outline color for the process icons.

param.name: disabledColor
param.label: Disabled color
param.info: In the diagram, some processes are not 'active', in the sense that there is no information available on their status. However, it may still be useful to show them in the diagram. In this case, the process icon is shown 'grayed' out, with this disabled color.

param.name: okColor
param.label: Ok color
param.description: Color for processes which are OK
param.info: This is the color for processes which have registered within the required period.

param.name: downColor
param.label: Down color
param.description: Color for processes which are DOWN
param.info: This is the color for processes which have not registered. They are considered down.

param.name: lateRegColor
param.label: Late reg color
param.description: Color for processes which are late in their registration
param.info: This is the color for processes which have not registered within the required period, but have registered within twice the required interval. They might be up but are having trouble completing their tasks before registering.

param.name: statusInvalidColor
param.label: Status invalid color
param.description: Color for processes for which no valid status is known.
param.info: This is the color for processes which have never registered and for which no information is available.

param.name: defaultWidth
param.label: Default width
param.description: Default width of a text box (pixels)
param.info: When a text box is created, it will have this width by default. You can then resize the box by entering a different value in the edit dialog.

param.name: defaultHeight
param.label: Default height
param.description: Default height of a text box (pixels)
param.info: When a text box is created, it will have this height by default. You can then resize the box by entering a different value in the edit dialog.

param.name: cornerRadius
param.label: Corner radius
param.info: The corners of the text box may optionally be rounded by a corner arc of this radius. Value is in pixels.

param.name: fontName
param.label: Font name
param.info: Set the font name for the text in the text boxes.

param.name: procmapHost
param.label: Procmap Host
param.description: Host where the procmap server is running
param.info: Host where the procmap server is running

param.name: procmapPort
param.label: Procmap Port
param.description: The port to connect to the procmapper
param.info: The port that sysview will use to connect to the procmapper

param.name: dataset
param.label: Dataset params
param.info: These parameters control how the information about the datasets is interpreted on the diagram.

param.name: outlineColor
param.label: Outline color
param.description: Color of the dataset icon outlines
param.info: Outline color for the dataset icons.

param.name: disabledColor
param.label: Disabled color
param.info: In the diagram, some datasets are not 'active', in the sense that there is no information available on their status. However, it may still be useful to show them in the diagram. In this case, the dataset icon is shown 'grayed' out, with this disabled color.

param.name: okColor
param.label: Ok color
param.description: Color for datasets which are OK
param.info: This is the color for datasets which have registered within the required period.

param.name: downColor
param.label: Down color
param.description: Color for datasets which are DOWN
param.info: This is the color for datasets which have not registered. They are considered down.

param.name: noDataColor
param.label: No data color
param.description: Color for datasets for which no data is available
param.info: This is the color for datasets for which there is no data available.

param.name: lateColor
param.label: Data late color
param.description: Color for datasets for which data is late
param.info: This is the color for datasets for which data has not come in within the late period.

param.name: veryLateColor
param.label: Data very late color
param.description: Color for datasets for which data is very late
param.info: This is the color for datasets for which data has not come in within the very late period.

param.name: statusInvalidColor
param.label: Status invalid color
param.description: Color for datasets for which no valid status is known.
param.info: This is the color for datasets which have never registered and for which no information is available.

param.name: defaultLateReference
param.label: Default reference time
param.description: Time stamp from which to measure late and very late offsets.
param.info: Determines which time is used to evaluate timeliness.

param.name: defaultLateSecs
param.label: Default late period
param.info: If data has not come in within the late secs period, it will be considered late. This is the default value for the late secs period which is assigned to a new data set. The value may then be edited on a dataset by dataset basis.

param.name: defaultVeryLateSecs
param.label: Default very late period
param.description: Default very late period - in secs
param.info: If data has not come in within the very late secs period, it will be considered very late. This is the default value for the very late secs period which is assigned to a new data set. The value may then be edited on a dataset by dataset basis.

param.label: Default width

param.name: gridRes
param.label: Grid resolution
param.info: A grid is placed on the canvas to aid in drawing. This is the color of the grid lines.

param.name: labelFontName
param.label: Font name
param.info: Set the font name for the labels in the diagram.

param.name: labelColor
param.label: Label color
param.info: Label color for the text in the diagram.

param.name: displayLastQueryTime
param.label: Display last query time?
param.description: Should the last query time be shown on sysview?
param.info: If this is true, the last query time will be displayed

param.name: lastQueryTimeFont
param.label: Font for last query time
param.description: Which Font to use for the last query time.
param.info: This is the font which will be used when the last query time is displayed

param.name: lastQueryTimeX
param.label: X for last query time
param.description: X location for last query time label
param.info: X location, in pixels from left margin, for last query time label.

param.name: lastQueryTimeY
param.label: Y for last query time
param.description: Y location for last query time label
param.info: Y location, in pixels from left margin, for last query time label.

param.name: windowX
param.label: X location of window
param.description: The window X offset from the top-left of screen

param.name: windowY
param.label: Y location of window
param.description: The window Y offset from the top-left of screen

param.name: lineColor
param.label: Line color
param.info: Flow lines indicate the logical flow of data or information through the diagram. This is the color of the flow lines

param.name: outlineColor
param.label: Outline color
param.info: Flow lines indicate the logical flow of data or information through the diagram. This is the outline color of the flow lines

param.name: fillArrowHead
param.label: Fill arrow head?
param.description: Set to true for solid arrow heads
param.info: Flow lines indicate the logical flow of data or information through the diagram. The lines optionally have arrowheads on the ends indicating the direction of information flow. If this is set true, the heads will be solid. If not, they will be open.

param.name: arrowHeadAngle
param.label: Arrow head angle
param.info: Flow lines indicate the logical flow of data or information through the diagram. The lines optionally have arrowheads on the ends indicating the direction of information flow. This is the angle of the arrowhead, in degrees.

param.name: arrowHeadLength
param.label: Arrow head length
param.info: Flow lines indicate the logical flow of data or information through the diagram. The lines optionally have arrowheads on the ends indicating the direction of information flow. This is the length of the arrowhead, in pixels.

param.name: lineColor
param.label: Line color
param.info: Poly lines are arbitrary multi-point lines used to help organize the information on the diagram. This is the color of the poly lines

param.name: outlineColor
param.label: Outline color
param.info: Poly lines are arbitrary multi-point lines used to help organize the information on the diagram. This is the outline color of the poly lines

param.info: Outline color for the text boxes.

param.label: Fill color
param.info: Fill color for the text boxes.

param.name: fontName
param.label: Font name
param.info: Set the font name for the text in the text boxes.

param.name: active
param.label: Autodump active?
param.info: If true, HTML autodump feature will be set active. Autodump creates images and html files which represent the SysView diagram state. These files are then available for viewing via a browser.

param.name: outdir
param.label: Output directory
param.info: The HTML and image files will be written to this directory. See also the 'outdir' parameter.

param.name: dated
param.label: Dated directories?
param.info: If true, the autodump files will be written into a subdirectory named from the current date.

param.name: template
param.label: Template file
param.info: The HTML autodump files are based upon this template. See also the 'insertToken' parameter. The top part of the file, down to the insertToken, is copied to the output file. Then the generated HTML content is inserted. Then the remainder of the file is copied.

param.name: insertToken
param.label: Insert token
param.description: Token for insert point in template file
param.info: The template file should have a line containing this insert token. The generated HTML content will be inserted into the template at this point - i.e it will replace the insert token.

param.name: objectInfo
param.label: Object info format
param.info: The object information can be either provided in HTML or graphical format.

param.name: dumpInterval
param.label: Dump interval (mins)
param.description: How often to dump - in minutes
param.info: The application will dump HTML files at regular intervals, controlled by this parameter. It will start dumping on the hour, and then regular intervals thereafter.

param.name: useLocalXML
param.label: Use Local XML Status Files
param.description: Status is determined by looking at local XML files
param.info: Querying the status of process, data, etc. over the network allows momentary network congestion appear as a more critical problem.

param.name: xmlStatusLocation
param.label: Path to XML status files
param.description: This is the full path to the XML status files.

param.name: maxAge
param.label: Max. age of an XML status file (sec)
param.description: XML status files older than this (sec) will not be used
param.info: When parsing XML files to get status information, the time in the filename will be used to determine if they are older than this.
